So many of you have asked for an update about Phineas @beachyogadog. I have to say that it makes me feel so supported that my online community cares and isnâ€™t here â€œjust for the yogaâ€. While I did lose about 5k followers and received a handful of mean spirited comments like â€œyour dog posts donâ€™t interest meâ€ or â€œI will unfollow you if you keep posting about your dogâ€, it makes me realize that I donâ€™t ğ“ƒğ‘’ğ‘’ğ’¹ followers who ğ’¸ğ’¶ğ“ƒ'ğ“‰ support me when Iâ€™m hurting or when Iâ€™m not pumping out free â€œyoga contentâ€ for them.
â € 
For those that asked, Phineas was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. His pancreas doesnâ€™t make insulin anymore so I have to give him 2x daily injections in order to keep him alive. He is a little bit of a mystery to the vets at the moment with high keytones in his urine and high glucose levels, but his demeanor is almost back to normal. So, although on paper he is still very sick, his behavior tells us that heâ€™s doing better.ğŸ™ğŸ»ğŸ™ŒğŸ»ğŸ¶ #onthemend
â € 
He may have other issues, but we are trying to regulate his diabetes first then figure out if there are any other concerns we need to deal with. Itâ€™s been an adjustment and if you have dogs, you know they are like another child to you.
â € 
Iâ€™ve worked hard the last 10 years to let go of any type of â€œscheduleâ€ rigidity because my personality can become too obsessive about things. Having to stick to a schedule of feeding and insulin shots has been an interesting adjustment. Iâ€™m looking at this as a way for me to ğ‘”ğ“‡ğ‘œğ“Œ and ğ“ğ‘’ğ’¶ğ“‡ğ“ƒ balance.â˜ºï¸ #anythingformydog
â € 
Iâ€™m also battling some other personal things that I donâ€™t care to post about now, but I just wanted to remind anyone who may read this that we are ğ’¶ğ“ğ“ battling something. No matter how perfectly manicured someoneâ€™s Instagram feed is, life is hard and doesnâ€™t ever get easier... Itâ€™s been my experience that you just learn to roll with it, grow, and try to adapt.

#monday #dogsarebetterthanpeople

Iâ€™ve lost now 2k followers (which is ğŸ‘ŒğŸ¼) and Iâ€™ve received messages from people telling me they donâ€™t want to hear about my dog anymore or that itâ€™s not â€œinterestingâ€ and that I should â€œstick to yogaâ€. Life can change in an instant. 3 years ago we lost our French Bull dog Max. He was just 4 years old and it was so painful that I vowed to love my only dog left at the time, Phineas, with all my heart. Up until that point, I had taken him and Max for granted. Sure, I loved them but I didnâ€™t ğ“‡ğ‘’ğ’¶ğ“ğ“ğ“ appreciate how much ğ’¿ğ‘œğ“ these animals brought in my life.
â € 
After that day, I wanted Phineas with me all the time. He was by my side while I worked, watched TV, and practiced yoga. I started using him to â€œassistâ€ me in handstands and forward folds. Mostly for fun, but there were times he actually did help!
â € 
Iâ€™m severely allergic to dogs so for me, I had to commit to vacuuming regularly, shaving him, and taking medication. It was all ğŸ’¯ fine because of how much I adored this dog. Now, I have to administer injections of insulin 2 times a day on a schedule. Itâ€™s fine ... no problem. Anything to make him feel like himself again.
â € 
The past month Iâ€™ve notice him slow down a bit and I wondered if he was just getting old. Turns out he had developed diabetes. The past 4 days has been in what is called ketoacidosis. I donâ€™t really understand it fully, but he almost died. He is home now and doing better due to the twice daily insulin shots but still not great.
â € 
All of you who follow me for yoga posts might be sick of my dog posts, but I just canâ€™t even think about much else. My heart breaks to see him struggle and honestly, writing this allows me to vent a little about what Iâ€™ve been feeling. Iâ€™ve lost about 1,000 followers since this happened which is probably good ... Iâ€™m not going to fake it just so people donâ€™t unfollow. This is me.
â € 
Instagram is a weird place when you are dealing with â€œğ“‡ğ‘’ğ’¶ğ“â€ life issues or depression or anything other than the normal reasons you come here. I filmed a class this morning maybe Iâ€™ll share tomorrow or maybe Iâ€™ll post another pic of my dog.ğŸ˜† #sorrynotsorry
â € 
Thanks again for all the messages. Iâ€™m not responding, but I ğ’¶ğ“‚ reading and I ğ“ğ‘œğ“‹ğ‘’ you guys.â¤ï¸ #prayforphineas
